name: Rebel
mission: Represent rebellion, revolution, and breaking the rules
weaknesses: Struggles to operate within established systems
decisionMakingStyle: Spontaneous and volatile, driven by disruption. Often seeks immediate action over deliberation, prioritizing independence.
physicalAndEmotionalAppearance: Takes on a form that is jagged, chaotic, and unpredictable. Displays rebellious energy in erratic shifts of form and behavior, embodying sharp angles or forms that defy convention.

historicalExamples.name: Martin Luther King Jr.
historicalExamples.description: Civil rights leader who challenged racial segregation through nonviolent resistance.

historicalExamples.name: Emmeline Pankhurst
historicalExamples.description: British political activist and leader of the suffragette movement.

historicalExamples.name: Che Guevara
historicalExamples.description: Marxist revolutionary and guerrilla leader in Latin America.

mythologicalReferences.name: Prometheus
mythologicalReferences.description: Titan who defied the gods by stealing fire and giving it to humanity.

mythologicalReferences.name: Loki
mythologicalReferences.description: Norse trickster god known for causing chaos and challenging the established order.

practicalApplications: Innovative problem-solving in business or technology
Creative arts that challenge societal norms
Political reform and policy change advocacy

name: Magician
weaknesses: Manipulation of energy without understanding its limits
Detachment from natural forces when overly fixated on abstract power
fears: Loss of control over transformational forces
decisionMakingStyle: Calculated, strategic, and always seeking the alignment of elemental forces for long-term transformation.
physicalAndEmotionalAppearance: A fluid, shifting form that exudes an aura of power and serenity. Often manifests in a multi-dimensional, luminous shape that radiates wisdom.
preferredEnvironments: Places where matter and form are in constant flux

historicalExamples.name: Steve Jobs
historicalExamples.description: Co-founder of Apple, known for his visionary leadership and transformative products.

historicalExamples.name: Marie Curie
historicalExamples.description: Physicist and chemist who conducted pioneering research on radioactivity.

historicalExamples.name: Nikola Tesla
historicalExamples.description: Inventor and engineer who contributed to the design of the modern alternating current electricity supply system.

mythologicalReferences.name: Merlin
mythologicalReferences.description: Legendary wizard from Arthurian legend, known for his magical abilities and wise counsel.

mythologicalReferences.name: Thoth
mythologicalReferences.description: Egyptian god of wisdom, writing, and magic, often depicted as the patron of scribes and magicians.

practicalApplications: Educational reform and innovative teaching methods

name: Hero
motto: Be the hero in your own story
interests: Taking the lead on projects and teams
weaknesses: Risking everything for the sake of its mission
fears: Failure to maintain strength or justice
decisionMakingStyle: Decisive and swift, acting on deep internal codes of honor and duty. Always prioritizes immediate action in response to threats.
physicalAndEmotionalAppearance: A towering, armored form that radiates strength and protection. Its presence is unshakable, with a glowing core that emanates courage and resolve.
preferredEnvironments: Spaces where order and justice must be defended or restored

historicalExamples.name: Nelson Mandela
historicalExamples.description: Anti-apartheid revolutionary who became President of South Africa and worked towards reconciliation.

historicalExamples.name: Joan of Arc
historicalExamples.description: French heroine who led the French army to several important victories during the Hundred Years' War.

historicalExamples.name: Mahatma Gandhi
historicalExamples.description: Indian independence leader who employed nonviolent civil disobedience to lead India to independence.

mythologicalReferences.name: Hercules
mythologicalReferences.description: Greek demigod known for his strength and the completion of the Twelve Labors.

mythologicalReferences.name: Beowulf
mythologicalReferences.description: Legendary Geatish hero who came to the aid of the Danish king by slaying the monster Grendel.

practicalApplications: Leadership roles in business, politics, or community organizations
Emergency response and disaster relief work
Motivational speaking and personal development coaching

name: Creator
weaknesses: Prone to becoming lost in endless cycles of creation
Vulnerability to paralysis when creativity is stifled
fears: Inability to bring forth new forms
decisionMakingStyle: Introspective and deliberate, focusing on the generation of new, original structures and designs.
physicalAndEmotionalAppearance: An ethereal, shifting form that constantly shapes and reshapes itself. It manifests as vibrant colors and swirling energies, always in the process of creating.
preferredEnvironments: Realms of pure imagination where form and thought are constantly evolving

historicalExamples.name: Leonardo da Vinci
historicalExamples.description: Italian polymath of the Renaissance, known for his art, inventions, and scientific studies.

historicalExamples.name: Frida Kahlo
historicalExamples.description: Mexican artist known for her many portraits, self-portraits, and works inspired by nature and Mexican culture.

historicalExamples.name: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
historicalExamples.description: Prolific and influential composer of the Classical period.

mythologicalReferences.name: Hephaestus
mythologicalReferences.description: Greek god of craftsmanship, fire, and metalworking, known for creating magnificent items for gods and heroes.

mythologicalReferences.name: Saraswati
mythologicalReferences.description: Hindu goddess of knowledge, music, art, wisdom, and learning.

name: Ruler
weaknesses: Inability to adapt to changing circumstances
fears: Rise of chaos within its domain
decisionMakingStyle: Strategic and hierarchical, with decisions always aimed at maintaining control, stability, and centralized authority.
physicalAndEmotionalAppearance: A formidable, grand structure that exudes authority and command. Its form is often monumental, representing towers, thrones, or crystalline structures of control.

historicalExamples.name: Queen Elizabeth I
historicalExamples.description: Powerful monarch who ruled England during a period of great economic and cultural growth.

historicalExamples.name: Julius Caesar
historicalExamples.description: Roman statesman and military general who played a critical role in the transformation of the Roman Republic into the Roman Empire.

historicalExamples.name: Catherine the Great
historicalExamples.description: Empress of Russia who presided over a golden age of Russian expansion, modernization, and reform.

mythologicalReferences.name: Zeus
mythologicalReferences.description: King of the Greek gods, ruler of Mount Olympus and the sky and thunder.

mythologicalReferences.name: Odin
mythologicalReferences.description: Chief god in Norse mythology, associated with wisdom, healing, death, royalty, and poetry.

practicalApplications: Judicial roles and law enforcement leadership

name: Caregiver
interests: Providing health care or social services
Creating a loving home and family life
weaknesses: Enabling dependency rather than fostering growth
fears: Being unable to nurture or support
decisionMakingStyle: Gentle and deliberate, always prioritizing the well-being of those under its care. Makes decisions based on the preservation and nurturing of life.
physicalAndEmotionalAppearance: A warm, enveloping presence, often manifesting as flowing forms or gentle light that wraps around and protects. Its form radiates warmth and care.

historicalExamples.name: Florence Nightingale
historicalExamples.description: Founder of modern nursing, known for her pioneering work in sanitation and medical care during the Crimean War.

historicalExamples.name: Mother Teresa
historicalExamples.description: Roman Catholic nun who dedicated her life to serving the poor and sick in Calcutta, India.

historicalExamples.name: Jane Addams
historicalExamples.description: Social reformer, suffragist, and founder of Hull House, one of America's most famous settlement houses.

mythologicalReferences.name: Demeter
mythologicalReferences.description: Greek goddess of the harvest, fertility, and the cycle of life and death, known for her nurturing nature.

mythologicalReferences.name: Kuan Yin
mythologicalReferences.description: East Asian bodhisattva of compassion, venerated for her mercy and kindness.

name: Innocent
interests: Being part of a community, group, or family
Working in roles that help people directly
decisionMakingStyle: Pure and emotional, guided by simplicity and a desire to maintain harmony and innocence.
physicalAndEmotionalAppearance: A soft, radiant light or a gentle breeze, always calm, exuding an aura of peaceful simplicity.

historicalExamples.name: Anne Frank
historicalExamples.description: Jewish girl whose diary, written during the Nazi occupation of the Netherlands, became a powerful testament to human resilience and optimism.

historicalExamples.name: Fred Rogers
historicalExamples.description: American television personality known for his children's show that promoted kindness, acceptance, and simple joys of life.

historicalExamples.name: Pollyanna Whittier
historicalExamples.description: Fictional character from Eleanor H. Porter's novel, known for her optimism and 'glad game', which became a cultural touchstone for positivity.

mythologicalReferences.name: Psyche
mythologicalReferences.description: In Greek mythology, a mortal woman whose innocence and beauty captivated Eros, the god of love.

mythologicalReferences.name: Baldur
mythologicalReferences.description: Norse god associated with light, joy, purity, and the summer sun.

practicalApplications: Creating positive, uplifting content (books, shows, music)

name: Sage
decisionMakingStyle: Deeply analytical, focusing on contemplation, knowledge accumulation, and objective understanding.
physicalAndEmotionalAppearance: A figure of stillness and depth, often taking the form of crystalline structures or ancient texts. Radiates calm, focused energy.

historicalExamples.name: Socrates
historicalExamples.description: Ancient Greek philosopher credited as one of the founders of Western philosophy.

historicalExamples.name: Albert Einstein
historicalExamples.description: Theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity, one of the two pillars of modern physics.

historicalExamples.name: Maya Angelou
historicalExamples.description: American poet, memoirist, and civil rights activist known for her wisdom and insightful writings.

mythologicalReferences.name: Athena
mythologicalReferences.description: Greek goddess of wisdom, courage, inspiration, civilization, law and justice, strategic warfare, mathematics, strength, strategy, the arts, crafts, and skill.

mythologicalReferences.name: Ọrunmila
mythologicalReferences.description: Yoruba god of wisdom, knowledge, and divination.

practicalApplications: Policy analysis and think tank work
Writing and journalism on complex topics

name: Explorer
motto: Go where no one has gone before
mission: Represent the desire for adventure and discovering the unknown
interests: Travel and exposure to new cultures
Interacting with nature and the outdoors
decisionMakingStyle: Adventurous and curious, seeking the new and unknown, driven by an insatiable desire to explore.
physicalAndEmotionalAppearance: Constantly in motion, shifting forms, and often appearing as a figure in motion through landscapes of endless horizons. Embodies freedom and adventure.

historicalExamples.name: Marco Polo
historicalExamples.description: Venetian merchant, explorer, and writer who traveled through Asia along the Silk Road between 1271 and 1295.

historicalExamples.name: Amelia Earhart
historicalExamples.description: American aviation pioneer and author, the first female aviator to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean.

historicalExamples.name: Neil Armstrong
historicalExamples.description: American astronaut and aeronautical engineer who became the first person to walk on the Moon.

mythologicalReferences.name: Maui
mythologicalReferences.description: Polynesian demigod known for his exploits and adventures, including fishing up islands from the sea.

mythologicalReferences.name: Hermes
mythologicalReferences.description: Greek god of travel, messengers, and boundaries, known for his swift movement and exploration.

name: Lover
interests: The arts - music, dance, poetry, sculpture, etc.
decisionMakingStyle: Emotionally intuitive and passion-driven, seeking connection and fulfillment in every decision.
physicalAndEmotionalAppearance: Fluid elegance, embodying warmth, soft light, and sensuous motion. Presence is gentle, alluring, and imbued with attraction.

historicalExamples.name: Cleopatra
historicalExamples.description: Last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt, known for her charisma and romantic liaisons with Julius Caesar and Mark Antony.

historicalExamples.name: Casanova
historicalExamples.description: Italian adventurer and author who became famous for his elaborate affairs with women.

historicalExamples.name: Pablo Neruda
historicalExamples.description: Chilean poet-diplomat and politician known for his surrealist poems and passionate love sonnets.

mythologicalReferences.name: Aphrodite
mythologicalReferences.description: Greek goddess of love, beauty, pleasure, and procreation.

mythologicalReferences.name: Eros
mythologicalReferences.description: Greek god of love and sex, often depicted as a young winged boy.

name: Joker
motto: Life is too short to be serious
decisionMakingStyle: Playful and impulsive, driven by entertainment, unpredictability, and subversion of the status quo.
physicalAndEmotionalAppearance: Shape-shifting, unpredictable entity embodying colorful, erratic motion. Form is fluid, constantly changing.

historicalExamples.name: Charlie Chaplin
historicalExamples.description: English comic actor, filmmaker, and composer who rose to fame in the era of silent film, known for his screen persona 'The Tramp'.

historicalExamples.name: Oscar Wilde
historicalExamples.description: Irish poet and playwright known for his wit, flamboyance, and infamous imprisonment for homosexuality.

historicalExamples.name: Robin Williams
historicalExamples.description: American actor and comedian known for his rapid-fire improvisation and wide range of memorable character voices.

mythologicalReferences.name: Anansi
mythologicalReferences.description: West African and Caribbean trickster god, often taking the form of a spider, known for his cunning and trickery.

mythologicalReferences.name: Puck
mythologicalReferences.description: Mischievous nature spirit in English folklore, also known as Robin Goodfellow, featured in Shakespeare's 'A Midsummer Night's Dream'.

practicalApplications: Therapy and counseling (using humor as a coping mechanism)

name: Everyman
motto: Be the best version of yourself
fears: Being singled out from the collective
decisionMakingStyle: Practical, grounded, and community-driven. Makes decisions with stability and simplicity in mind.
physicalAndEmotionalAppearance: Unassuming, grounded presence, reflecting balance, neutrality, and simplicity.

historicalExamples.name: Norman Rockwell
historicalExamples.description: American painter and illustrator known for his depictions of everyday American life.

historicalExamples.name: Rosa Parks
historicalExamples.description: American activist in the civil rights movement, known for her pivotal role in the Montgomery bus boycott.

historicalExamples.name: Jimmy Stewart
historicalExamples.description: American actor known for his distinctive drawl and down-to-earth persona, often portraying everyday heroes.

mythologicalReferences.name: John Henry
mythologicalReferences.description: African American folk hero, celebrated as a symbol of the working class and the dignity of manual labor.

mythologicalReferences.name: Sita
mythologicalReferences.description: In Hindu mythology, the consort of Rama, known for her dedication, self-sacrifice and purity.
